intro: Psychotria fuscula, commonly known as the red-eyed or red-veined evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent red veins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria fuscula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and compact growth habit.
